did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: This collection contains the political papers of Gabrielle Giffords that document her career as a member of the United States House of Representatives from 2007-2012 as well as the shooting at Giffords’ “Congress on your Corner” event on January 8, 2011. It is organized into 3 subgroups with the bulk of the collection found in the committee files as well as in materials related to the January 8th, 2011 Tucson, Arizona shooting. The collection also contains correspondence, legislative files, voting records, subject files, photographs and audio visual materials. This collection also contains a substantial amount of electronic records. THIS COLLECTION IS CURRENTLY CLOSED. PLEASE CONTACT AN ARCHIVIST IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO VIEW MATERIALS.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Gabrielle Giffords Papers (MS 545)>. Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Gabrielle Dee Giffords was born June 8, 1970 in Tucson, Arizona to Spencer and Gloria Giffords. She graduated from University High School in 1988 and attended Scripps College. Graduating in 1993, she majored in Latin American studies and sociology after which she won a Fulbright Scholarship and spent a year studying in Chihuahua, Mexico. She then attended Cornell University, graduating with a master’s degree in regional planning in 1996. She returned to Tucson to run her family tire business until it was sold in 2000. She married U.S. Navy pilot and NASA astronaut Mark Kelly in 2007.

In 2000 she ran for state office citing the difficulties in owning a small business as an impetus for running. She was elected to the Arizona House from 2001 to 2003 and the Arizona Senate from 2003 to 2005 when she resigned to pursue the soon to be vacated US House seat held by Congressman Jim Kolbe. She was elected to Arizona’s 8th congressional district for the 110th to 112th Congress. She served on the Armed Services, Foreign Affairs and Science and Technology committees throughout her congressional career. She was also the ranking member of the Space and Aeronautics subcommittee of the Space and Technology committee during the 111th Congress. She was a member of the Blue Dog Coalition, supported immigration reform and border security and was an advocate for solar energy.

On January 8, 2011 at a “Congress on your Corner” event a gunman killed six and injured 13 others. Federal Judge John Roll and Giffords staffer Gabriel Zimmerman were among those killed. Giffords was shot in the head but survived and made a remarkable recovery. She returned to the House to vote on the debt ceiling bill in August 2011 but resigned from Congress in January 2012 to focus on her recovery.

Since her resignation Giffords and her husband Mark Kelly have focused on gun control legislation. On the second anniversary of the Tucson shooting, they launched Americans for Responsible Solutions, a political action committee aimed at the prevention of gun violence and responsible gun ownership.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into 3 Subgroups

list.item: Subgroup III: January 8, 2011 Tucson, Arizona shooting, 2011-2012

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the political papers of Democratic Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords that document her career as a member of the United States House of Representatives in Arizona’s 8th District (2007-2012). The collection includes campaign materials, committee files, legislative files, voting records, speeches, office files, correspondence, press files and subject files as well as photographs and audio visual materials. Also included are materials related to the January 8, 2011 shooting of Gabrielle Giffords and 18 others at a Tucson “Congress on your Corner” event which includes correspondence such as well wishes, press clippings and memorabilia.

relatedmaterial.p: Contact Tucson’s January 8 Memorial Foundation for more information about materials related to the January 8th, 2011 shooting.

item.subject: United States Politics and government--20th century.

scopecontent.p: This subgroup contains materials related to Giffords’ congressional career including committee files, legislative activity files, voting records, speeches, office files, correspondence, press files and issue files.

This series contains materials related to Giffords’ committee work including her work on the Armed Services Committee, Subcommittee on Tactical Air and Land Forces and Subcommittee on Readiness; Foreign Affairs Committee, and the Science and Technology Committee, Subcommittee on Space and Aeronautics (ranking member) and Subcommittee on Technology and Innovation. It is arranged alphabetically.
This subseries contains materials related to Giffords’ work on the Armed Services committee such as legislation, Dear Colleague letters, appropriations and issues related to the armed services.

scopecontent.p: This series contains materials related to Giffords’ congressional activities including appropriations requests, the Blue Dog Coalition, bill cosponsor solicitations, floor statements, legislative work primarily on the border, immigration, healthcare and energy, district related legislation and some research for legislative work. It is arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.p: This series contains guides outlining her legislative activities and vote ratings.
This series contains the speeches given by Giffords for various events. It is arranged chronologically.
This series contains invitations to events, congratulatory letters and cards, form letters, letters with other officials and from constituents.
This subseries contains invitations to events as well as thank you and congratulatory letters and cards. Also included are Giffords outgoing congratulatory letters. It is arranged alphabetically.
This subseries contains letters from a variety of government officials as well as Giffords outgoing correspondence to other officials. It is arranged alphabetically.

This subseries contains correspondence from constituents organized by year and month as well as form letters sent from constituents on a variety of issues, primarily legislation. Form letters were sampled. It is arranged alphabetically.
This subseries contains form letter responses from Giffords covering a wide array of topics. It is arranged alphabetically by topic.
This series contains schedules, event and travel itineraries and materials related to the management of Giffords’ office.
This subseries contains schedules and schedule analyses by topic. It is arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.p: This subseries contains correspondence and itineraries related to Giffords’ travel primarily for congressional delegations. It is arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.p: This series contains news clippings, franked mail, newsletters and articles written by Giffords. It is arranged alphabetically.

This subgroup contains photographs, audio visual materials and memorabilia. Some access copies of audio visual materials are available. The migrated copies of these audio visual materials were transferred from the originals in 2015.

Some documents such as presentations and other documents are also included.

Subgroup III: January 8, 2011 Tucson, Arizona shooting

scopecontent.p: This subgroup contains materials related to the shooting at Giffords’ “Congress on your Corner” event that killed six including Giffords’ congressional staffer Gabriel Zimmerman and injured 13. Gabrielle Giffords was shot in the head but survived. The bulk of the materials came from her district and congressional office. Included are well wishes, press clippings and memorabilia. For additional materials related to the January 8th memorials please contact Tucson’s January 8 Memorial Foundation.

This series contains correspondence, primarily cards and letters sent by the public to Giffords after the shooting. Also included are well wishes from public figures as well as cards to other victims, primarily Gabe Zimmerman’s family. Well wishes to Giffords were sampled.

scopecontent.p: This series contains clippings related to the shooting, Giffords recovery, her return to Congress and her resignation.
This series contains a CD of photographs and DVDs of programs related to the shooting.
